00029 #include <stdlib.h>
00030 #include <string.h> /* for memcpy */
00031 
00032 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00033 #include "BLI_listbase.h"

00061 void *BMW_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *start)
00062 {
00063     walker->begin(walker, start);
00064     
00065     return BMW_current_state(walker) ? walker->step(walker) : NULL;
00066 }
00067 
00075 void BMW_init(BMWalker *walker, BMesh *bm, int type,
00076               short mask_vert, short mask_edge, short mask_face,
00077               BMWFlag flag,
00078               int layer)
00079 {
00080     memset(walker, 0, sizeof(BMWalker));
00081 
00082     walker->layer = layer;
00083     walker->flag = flag;
00084     walker->bm = bm;
00085 
00086     walker->mask_vert = mask_vert;
00087     walker->mask_edge = mask_edge;
00088     walker->mask_face = mask_face;
00089 
00090     walker->visithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 1");
00091     walker->secvisithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers sec 1");
00092 
00093     if (UNLIKELY(type >= BMW_MAXWALKERS || type < 0)) {
00094         fprintf(stderr,
00095                 "Invalid walker type in BMW_init; type: %d, "
00096                 "searchmask: (v:%d, e:%d, f:%d), flag: %d, layer: %d\n",
00097                 type, mask_vert, mask_edge, mask_face, flag, layer);
00098         BMESH_ASSERT(0);
00099     }
00100     
00101     if (type != BMW_CUSTOM) {
00102         walker->begin = bm_walker_types[type]->begin;
00103         walker->yield = bm_walker_types[type]->yield;
00104         walker->step = bm_walker_types[type]->step;
00105         walker->structsize = bm_walker_types[type]->structsize;
00106         walker->order = bm_walker_types[type]->order;
00107         walker->valid_mask = bm_walker_types[type]->valid_mask;
00108 
00109         /* safety checks */
00110         /* if this raises an error either the caller is wrong or
00111          * 'bm_walker_types' needs updating */
00112         BLI_assert(mask_vert == 0 || (walker->valid_mask & BM_VERT));
00113         BLI_assert(mask_edge == 0 || (walker->valid_mask & BM_EDGE));
00114         BLI_assert(mask_face == 0 || (walker->valid_mask & BM_FACE));
00115     }
00116     
00117     walker->worklist = BLI_mempool_create(walker->structsize, 100, 100, BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC);
00118     walker->states.first = walker->states.last = NULL;
00119 }
00120 
00126 void BMW_end(BMWalker *walker)
00127 {
00128     BLI_mempool_destroy(walker->worklist);
00129     BLI_ghash_free(walker->visithash, NULL, NULL);
00130     BLI_ghash_free(walker->secvisithash, NULL, NULL);
00131 }
00132 
00133 
00137 void *BMW_step(BMWalker *walker)
00138 {
00139     BMHeader *head;
00140 
00141     head = BMW_walk(walker);
00142 
00143     return head;
00144 }
00145 
00152 int BMW_current_depth(BMWalker *walker)
00153 {
00154     return walker->depth;
00155 }
00156 
00162 void *BMW_walk(BMWalker *walker)
00163 {
00164     void *current = NULL;
00165 
00166     while (BMW_current_state(walker)) {
00167         current = walker->step(walker);
00168         if (current) {
00169             return current;
00170         }
00171     }
00172     return NULL;
00173 }
00174 
00182 void *BMW_current_state(BMWalker *walker)
00183 {
00184     BMwGenericWalker *currentstate = walker->states.first;
00185     if (currentstate) {
00186         /* Automatic update of depth. For most walkers that
00187          * follow the standard "Step" pattern of:
00188          *  - read current state
00189          *  - remove current state
00190          *  - push new states
00191          *  - return walk result from just-removed current state
00192          * this simple automatic update should keep track of depth
00193          * just fine. Walkers that deviate from that pattern may
00194          * need to manually update the depth if they care about
00195          * keeping it correct. */
00196         walker->depth = currentstate->depth + 1;
00197     }
00198     return currentstate;
00199 }
00200 
00207 void BMW_state_remove(BMWalker *walker)
00208 {
00209     void *oldstate;
00210     oldstate = BMW_current_state(walker);
00211     BLI_remlink(&walker->states, oldstate);
00212     BLI_mempool_free(walker->worklist, oldstate);
00213 }
00214 
00224 void *BMW_state_add(BMWalker *walker)
00225 {
00226     BMwGenericWalker *newstate;
00227     newstate = BLI_mempool_alloc(walker->worklist);
00228     newstate->depth = walker->depth;
00229     switch (walker->order)
00230     {
00231         case BMW_DEPTH_FIRST:
00232             BLI_addhead(&walker->states, newstate);
00233             break;
00234         case BMW_BREADTH_FIRST:
00235             BLI_addtail(&walker->states, newstate);
00236             break;
00237         default:
00238             BLI_assert(0);
00239             break;
00240     }
00241     return newstate;
00242 }
00243 
00250 void BMW_reset(BMWalker *walker)
00251 {
00252     while (BMW_current_state(walker)) {
00253         BMW_state_remove(walker);
00254     }
00255     walker->depth = 0;
00256     BLI_ghash_free(walker->visithash, NULL, NULL);
00257     BLI_ghash_free(walker->secvisithash, NULL, NULL);
00258     walker->visithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers 1");
00259     walker->secvisithash = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "bmesh walkers sec 1");
00260 }
